name: Chicken Piccatta
ingredients: 3 ½ lb. chicken cut in quarters
8 oz. water or water and wine
2 cans whole San Marzano plum Tomatoes (loose chop)
instructions: Pound chicken breasts – paper towel dry, lightly flour
Add chicken and brown on both sides
In same skillet, over low heat, melt margarine
Add chicken and cook about 5 minutes, coating well with margarine
Add wine to pan drippings – cook and stir about 4 minutes
Stir in lemon juice and parsley – cook a few more minutes
Sauté the chicken lightly in a little oil with onion
Add carrots, celery, leeks, thyme, parsley, and bay leaf
Thicken and add to the above
Can be served with biscuits or topped with pastry and baked.
Wash, dry and dip chicken in flour seasoned with salt & pepper
Fry lightly in pan with olive oil & a little butter
Add garlic, fresh rosemary and parsley
Add about 8 oz. water or water and wine
In separate pan, lightly fry 2-3 onions and 2-3 red & green peppers
Add to chicken pan with 2 cans whole San Marzano plum tomatoes (loose chop)
Simmer until chicken is ready (1 hour)
